title: Fix blank page by switching to a resilient React entry module

requirements.summary: Add a resilient React entry module that always mounts <App /> to #root with exactly one QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
acceptanceCriteria: Running `pnpm run dev` renders the site content (header/nav and Home page) instead of a blank screen.
The React entry point renders `<App />` and includes `QueryClientProvider` and `InternetIdentityProvider` wrappers exactly once (no duplicate React Query provider in the mounted tree).
No user-facing text is changed as part of this fix (only mounting/bootstrapping behavior).

file_operations.description: Create a new React entry module that imports global styles, creates a single React Query QueryClient instance, and mounts a React element tree to the '#root' element by rendering <App /> wrapped exactly once with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider. Use the selected 'core-infrastructure' component patterns for the React app entry point where applicable; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Avoid editing immutable entry-point and hook files by switching index.html to load the new entry module instead of src/main.tsx.
acceptanceCriteria: No changes are made to any immutable paths listed by the platform (including frontend/src/main.tsx and Internet Identity hook files).
frontend/index.html loads the new entry module and the app renders correctly.
The build (`pnpm run build`) and preview (`pnpm run preview`) still work and show the same pages/routes.

file_operations.description: Update the Vite module script import to load the new entry module (e.g., /src/entry.tsx) instead of /src/main.tsx, ensuring local dev, build, and preview mount the app even if frontend/src/main.tsx is empty.
